message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper is about context-aware language modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a new mechanism for adapting RNNs, which is related to machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL), so cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses context information to improve the performance of the model, which is related to artificial intelligence (AI) and neural networks (NN), so cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses experiments to evaluate the proposed method, which involves classification and perplexity, so cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is a less likely but still possible sub-category.
